content:
WindowsFormsHost Class

Definition

An element that allows you to host a Windows Forms control on a WPF page.

In this Article

[System.ComponentModel.DefaultEvent("ChildChanged")]
[System.ComponentModel.DesignerCategory("code")]
[System.Windows.Markup.ContentProperty("Child")]
public class WindowsFormsHost : System.Windows.Interop.HwndHost, System.Windows.Interop.IKeyboardInputSink

Remarks

Use the WindowsFormsHost element to place a Windows Forms control within your WPF element or page.

To host a WPF element in a Windows Forms control or form, use the ElementHost control.

Note

WindowsFormsIntegration.dll is installed with the Windows Presentation Foundation (WPF) assemblies. The default location for the assembly is %programfiles%\Reference Assemblies\Microsoft\Framework\v3.0\WindowsFormsIntegration.dll.

To host a Windows Forms control in a WPF element, you must assign the Windows Forms control to the Child property.

Use the PropertyMap property to assign custom mappings between a WindowsFormsHost element and its hosted Windows Forms control. For more information, see Windows Forms and WPF Property Mapping.

XAML Object Element Usage

<WindowsFormsHost.../>

Constructors

WindowsFormsHost()

Initializes a new instance of the WindowsFormsHost class.

public WindowsFormsHost ();

Properties

Background

Gets or sets the hosted control's background as an ambient property.

public System.Windows.Media.Brush Background { get; set; }
Value
Brush

A Brush set to the background color.

Remarks

This dependency property is identified by the BackgroundProperty field. By default, this property is mapped to update the BackColor and BackgroundImage properties of the hosted control.

For more information on mapping the Background property, see Windows Forms and WPF Property Mapping.

XAML Attribute Usage

<object Background="Brush"/>

XAML Values

Brush
See Brush for XAML Attribute syntax.

Dependency Property Information
Identifier field BackgroundProperty
Metadata properties set to true AffectsRender, SubPropertiesDoNotAffectRender

Child

Gets or sets the child control hosted by the WindowsFormsHost element.

public System.Windows.Forms.Control Child { get; set; }
Value
Control

The hosted Windows Forms control.

Exceptions
ArgumentException

An attempt was made to assign a top-level form as the hosted control.

Remarks

Only one child control can be hosted, but Child can have any number of children.

The child control cannot be a top-level form.

If Child is a Form, the form's ControlBox property is set to false.

XAML Text Usage

< object >

< hostedControl .../>

</ object >

XAML Values

object
A WindowsFormsHost element (or a possible subclass).

hostedControl
An element that specifies the hosted Windows Forms control. Specifying the custom control in markup usually requires an xmlns mapping, see XAML Namespaces and Namespace Mapping for WPF XAML.

FontFamily

Gets or sets the hosted control's font family.

public System.Windows.Media.FontFamily FontFamily { get; set; }
Value
FontFamily

The font family used in the hosted control.

Remarks

This property setting affects only those controls whose template uses the property as a parameter. It has no effect on other controls.

This dependency property is identified by the FontFamilyProperty field. By default, this property is mapped to update the Font property of the hosted control. For more information, see Windows Forms and WPF Property Mapping.

XAML Attribute Usage

<object FontFamily="fontFamily"/>

XAML Values

fontFamily
See FontFamily for XAML Attribute syntax.

Dependency Property Information
Identifier field FontFamilyProperty
Metadata properties set to true AffectsMeasure, AffectsRender, Inherits

FontSize

Gets or sets the hosted control's font size.

public double FontSize { get; set; }
Value
Double

The font size used in the hosted control.

Remarks

This dependency property is identified by the FontSizeProperty field. By default, this property is mapped to update the Font property of the hosted control. For more information, see Windows Forms and WPF Property Mapping.

XAML Attribute Usage

<object FontSize="double"/>

XAML Values

double
String representation of a Double value equal to or greater than 0.0, but smaller than PositiveInfinity. This is interpreted as a device-independent unit (1/96th inch) measurement. Strings need not explicitly include decimal points. For instance a value of 1 is acceptable.

Dependency Property Information
Identifier field FontSizeProperty
Metadata properties set to true AffectsMeasure, AffectsRender, Inherits

public System.Windows.Media.Brush Foreground { get; set; }

Brush

A Brush used to set the foreground color for the hosted control.

Remarks

This dependency property is identified by the ForegroundProperty field. By default, this property is mapped to update the ForeColor property of the hosted control. For more information on mapping the Foreground property, see Windows Forms and WPF Property Mapping.

XAML Attribute Usage

<object Foreground="Brush"/>

XAML Values

Brush
See Brush for XAML Attribute syntax.

Dependency Property Information
Identifier field ForegroundProperty

Inherits

Specifies the size of the desired padding within the hosted Windows Forms control.

public System.Windows.Thickness Padding { get; set; }
Value
Thickness

A Thickness structure representing the padding pf the hosted Windows Forms control.

Remarks

XAML Attribute Usage

<object Padding="Thickness"/>

XAML Values

Thickness
See Thickness for XAML Attribute syntax.

Dependency Property Information
Identifier field PaddingProperty
Metadata properties set to true AffectsParentMeasure

PropertyMap

Gets the property map that determines how setting properties on the WindowsFormsHost element affects the hosted Windows Forms control.

public System.Windows.Forms.Integration.PropertyMap PropertyMap { get; }
Value
PropertyMap

A PropertyMap that maps WindowsFormsHost properties to properties on the hosted Windows Forms control.

Remarks

The Windows Forms and WPF technologies have two similar but different property models. Property mapping supports interoperation between the two architectures. For more information, see Windows Forms and WPF Property Mapping.

TabIndex

Gets or sets the hosted control's tab index.

public int TabIndex { get; set; }
Value
Int32

The tab index for tab navigation and focus.

Remarks

This dependency property is identified by the TabIndexProperty field.

Use this property to change the order of tab navigation among the controls on a form. A control with a lower tab index will get focus before a control with a higher index.

XAML Attribute Usage

<object TabIndex="int"/>

Dependency Property Information
Identifier field TabIndexProperty
Metadata properties set to true None

Methods

ArrangeOverride(Size)

When implemented in a derived class, positions child elements and determines a size for a FrameworkElement-derived class.

protected override System.Windows.Size ArrangeOverride (System.Windows.Size finalSize);
finalSize
Size

The final area within the parent that this element should use to arrange itself and its children.

Returns
Size

The actual size used.

BuildWindowCore(HandleRef)

Overrides the base class implementation of stem.Windows.Interop.HwndHost.BuildWindowCore* to build the hosted Windows Forms control.

protected override System.Runtime.InteropServices.HandleRef BuildWindowCore (System.Runtime.InteropServices.HandleRef hwndParent);
hwndParent
HandleRef

The parent window's handle (HWND).

Returns
HandleRef

The window handle for this object.

DestroyWindowCore(HandleRef)

Overrides stem.Windows.Interop.HwndHost.DestroyWindowCore* to delete the window containing this object.

protected override void DestroyWindowCore (System.Runtime.InteropServices.HandleRef hwnd);
hwnd
HandleRef

A window handle. This parameter is not used.

Dispose(Boolean)

Releases the unmanaged resources used by the WindowsFormsHost, and optionally releases the managed resources.

protected override void Dispose (bool disposing);
disposing
Boolean

true to release both managed and unmanaged resources; false to release only unmanaged resources.

Remarks

Calling the Dispose method disposes the base HwndHost and the Child control.

EnableWindowsFormsInterop()

Enables a Form to function correctly when it is opened modelessly from WPF.

public static void EnableWindowsFormsInterop ();

Remarks

Call the EnableWindowsFormsInterop method to forward all keyboard messages when a System.Windows.Forms.Form is opened modelessly. The EnableWindowsFormsInterop method installs a message filter that is required for modeless forms to function correctly when opened by WPF. You need to call this method only once for a particular WindowsFormsHost instance.

MeasureOverride(Size)

Overrides the base class implementation of stem.Windows.Interop.HwndHost.MeasureOverride* to measure the size of a WindowsFormsHost object and return proper sizes to the layout engine.

protected override System.Windows.Size MeasureOverride (System.Windows.Size constraint);
constraint
Size

The available size for the WindowsFormsHost object.

Returns
Size

The desired size of the WindowsFormsHost object.

Remarks

Size constraints in WPF layout are hard constraints. If the constraints are exceeded, the host must clip the content within the hosted region. The implementation of this method enforces this behavior.

OnCreateAutomationPeer()

Creates a WindowsFormsHostAutomationPeer for the WindowsFormsHost element.

protected override System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer OnCreateAutomationPeer ();
Returns
AutomationPeer

A WindowsFormsHostAutomationPeer for the WindowsFormsHost element.

OnPropertyChanged(DependencyPropertyChangedEventArgs)

Forces the translation of a mapped property.

protected override void OnPropertyChanged (System.Windows.DependencyPropertyChangedEventArgs e);
e
DependencyPropertyChangedEventArgs

Arguments that identify the property that changed as well as providing that property's old and new values.

Remarks

Calling the OnPropertyChanged method may be necessary when a property of an ancestor element has changed, but the local value of the WindowsFormsHost element has not changed. For more information, see Windows Forms and WPF Property Mapping.

ScaleChild(Vector)

Scales the hosted Windows Forms control, and tracks the scale factor.

protected virtual System.Windows.Vector ScaleChild (System.Windows.Vector newScale);
newScale
Vector

The new scale factor.

Returns
Vector

A Vector which represents the scale factor applied to the hosted Windows Forms control.

Remarks

Windows Forms controls do not support scaling in the same way as WPF elements. For example, scaling a Windows Forms control from a factor of 1 to a factor of 0.5 and back to a factor of 1 does not, in general, recover the original size of the control. For more information, see Layout Considerations for the WindowsFormsHost Element.

Override the ScaleChild method to provide custom scaling behavior for the hosted Windows Forms control.

TabInto(TraversalRequest)

Forwards focus from WPF to the hosted Windows Forms control.

public virtual bool TabInto (System.Windows.Input.TraversalRequest request);
request
TraversalRequest

A TraversalRequest that specifies the focus behavior.

Returns
Boolean

true if a control was activated; otherwise, false.

Remarks

When a WindowsFormsHost element receives a TAB command from the TabInto method, the first eligible control in Child receives focus.

The first control is specified by the request parameter. When request is FocusNavigationDirection, the behavior is similar to pressing the TAB key. When request is FocusNavigationDirection, the behavior is similar to pressing SHIFT+TAB.

WndProc(IntPtr,Int32,IntPtr,IntPtr,Boolean)

When implemented in a derived class, accesses the window process of the hosted child window.

protected override IntPtr WndProc (IntPtr hwnd, int msg, IntPtr wParam, IntPtr lParam, ref bool handled);
hwnd
IntPtr

Window handle of the hosted window.

msg
Int32

Message to act upon.

wParam
IntPtr

Information that may be relevant to handling the message. This is typically used to store small pieces of information, such as flags.

lParam
IntPtr

Information that may be relevant to handling the message. This is typically used to reference an object.

handled
Boolean

Whether events resulting should be marked handled.

Returns
IntPtr

The window handle of the child window.

Events

ChildChanged

Occurs when the stem.Windows.Forms.Integration.WindowsFormsHost.Child* property is set.

public event EventHandler<System.Windows.Forms.Integration.ChildChangedEventArgs> ChildChanged;

Remarks

XAML Attribute Usage

<object ChildChanged="eventHandler"/>

LayoutError

Occurs when a layout error, such as a skew or rotation that WindowsFormsHost does not support, is encountered.

public event EventHandler<System.Windows.Forms.Integration.LayoutExceptionEventArgs> LayoutError;

Remarks

XAML Attribute Usage

<object LayoutError="eventHandler"/>
